title: Typos - eSports Guidelines
body:
Hi there,

This is my third time attempting to post this, for some reason I can't create the thread with the screenshot but I can go back and add the attachment once it's posted.

Small thing, I know, but there are a couple of typos on the Culture Guidelines in the eSports board.  Here's a transcript:

>This is the place to keep up to date about whatâ€™s going on in the professional League of Legends scene. Discuss the latest events, your favorite player, the badass Pentakill in the game ***your*** watching, or anything else in ***then*** League of Legends Esports universe.

By the way, is it supposed to be Esports or eSports?  Or maybe e-Sports?  E-Sports?

replies.body: Thanks for pointing these out, they should be fixed now. As for the other issue, I'd recommend seeing if you can re-create it and post steps with screenshots in a separate thread. Feel free to reply to me here with the link and I'll make sure the devs see it.

The same typo is also present at the same place in the Tips & Tricks section.

edit: fixed a typo. The irony.
My assumption is that it has to do with my absurdly slow work computer, but I'll attempt to recreate it.

> Hi there,
> 
> This is my third time attempting to post this, for some reason I can't create the thread with the screenshot but I can go back and add the attachment once it's posted.

I think it would be more appropriate to stick with 1 thread | 1 topic, and make this into a seperate thread.

> By the way, is it supposed to be Esports or eSports?  Or maybe e-Sports?  E-Sports?

It seems to be Esports right now so it'll make sense with the rest of the boards visually. I'm personally a fan of eSports, which I think will naturally morph into esports, a la email.

>I think it would be more appropriate to stick with 1 thread | 1 topic, and make this into a seperate thread.

If it recurs I likely will, but I didn't feel it detracted much.

 >It seems to be Esports right now so it'll make sense with the rest of the boards visually.

Half the time it is listed as eSports, half the time it's Esports.  eSports looks infinitely better in my opinion, mainly because it makes grammatical sense.  Esports really doesn't, as it reads "eh-spOHRts" or "EHS-pohrts" rather than "EE-sports".
---
ANYWAY, off topic.  Typos.  Yep.
